title: 820-3332 cpu panic?
message:
MacBook came in with quarter fanspin, turns out one of the legs of U6100 was ripped off the board. ran a jumper from the chip to the board and it is now booting
When booting about 1/3 of the progress bar the screen will flicker and will continue to startup normally, but if it doesn't flicker when it gets there it will just sit on the loading bar at 1/3

In ASD OS "IC0R" fails looked at u5400 area looks perfect.
It's acting really strange symptoms are like the usual U8900 job. But have reflowed and soldered that twice now. Sometimes it will freeze up when using it and this is the log I get, CPU panic?




Anonymous UUID:       F506F786-C880-55BA-B422-118908AADD2C

Fri Aug 18 12:47:47 2017

*** Panic Report ***
panic(cpu 4 caller 0xffffff802b605ecd): Kernel trap at 0xffffff7fadde3fd4, type 14=page fault, registers:
CR0: 0x000000008001003b, CR2: 0xffffff8135b35e58, CR3: 0x000000001ec6d00a, CR4: 0x00000000001626e0
RAX: 0xffffff7fade2c9c8, RBX: 0xffffff8042f2c800, RCX: 0xffffff8135b35e00, RDX: 0x0000000000000107
RSP: 0xffffff913a0636f0, RBP: 0xffffff913a0636f0, RSI: 0x0000000000000002, RDI: 0xffffff8042f2c800
R8:  0xffffff913a0633b8, R9:  0xffffff913a0633b0, R10: 0x0000000000000000, R11: 0x0000000000000000
R12: 0x000000000000002f, R13: 0xffffff80fe1a1000, R14: 0x0000000000000000, R15: 0x0000000000000004
RFL: 0x0000000000010286, RIP: 0xffffff7fadde3fd4, CS:  0x0000000000000008, SS:  0x0000000000000010
Fault CR2: 0xffffff8135b35e58, Error code: 0x0000000000000000, Fault CPU: 0x4, PL: 0, VF: 1

title: 820-3332 cpu panic?
message:
Just noticed when i do get it to startup it will continue working but 30 seconds or so after plugging the charger in it will stop working, ie. cursor is spinning wheel and cant click on things, but cursor still moves


ASD EFI passes no problems, IC0R reads 0.6

title: 820-3332 cpu panic?
message: Beeing That u6100 leg is ripped of That dont magicly happen. Prefucked iT is. Check rest of the board again?

title: 820-3332 cpu panic?
message: Yeah I've gone over the board several times haven't found anything out of the ordinary

title: 820-3332 cpu panic?
message:
took off heatsink and found a boatload of thermal paste, it was everywhere covering all the resistors and all. Hoped cleaning it off would fix it but no difference.
Swapped out u8900 still no difference. It seems the problem occurs when it tries to use the nvidia gpu

title: 820-3332 cpu panic?
message: Did they fuck with the GPU? I bet this is a fucked up reflow or something. Are the black plastic coverings on the CPU/GPU in tact?

title: 820-3332 cpu panic?
message: Gpu cover looks untouched, seems to have fixed itself for now
